ConfigSetting.remarks: This value is managed by the KSP core. Its value is automatically read from the part's config. Despite of this field is declared as public, the other components must not be accessing it. The settings that are allowed for reading and/or writing should be exposed via a module's public property.

PersistentConfigSetting.remarks: This value is managed by the KSP core. Its initial value is read from the part's config, and then the value is read from/written into the vessel's config. Despite of this field is declared as public, the other components must not be accessing it. The settings that are allowed for reading and/or writing should be exposed via a module's public property.

remarks.para: This value is managed by the KSP core. Its initial value is read from the part's config. The value is presented in the part's context menu. Depending on the field's properties it can just show a value or allow changing it.
Avoid accessing the properties of the fields from the other classes. Instead, the owner class should provide a related field object.

The methods that are attributed as KSP events will show up in the part's context menu. Such methods must always be declared as public to let the KSP core correctly handling them. In case of the module class is not sealed, it highly encouraged to define the methods also as virtual.
Avoid accessing the events from the other classes. Instead, the owner class should provide a related fields or methods.

PersistentField.remarks: This value can be loaded or saved via a ConfigAccessor utility class.
